title: Pat Cipollone concludes closed-door meeting with January 6 committee
description: The House select committee investigating the January 6, 2021, insurrection is expected to ask Trump White House Counsel Pat Cipollone during a closed-door interview on Friday about what he witnessed in the waning days of Donald Trump's administration when the former President and his allies tried to overturn the election.

title: Biden spoke with Paul Whelan's sister amid pressure to bring detained Americans home
description: President Joe Biden on Friday spoke with Paul Whelan's sister about the former Marine's detainment in Russia and "reaffirmed that he is committed to bringing Paul home as soon as possible," according to a statement from a White House official.

title: Japan reels from assassination of former Prime Minister
Diet showdown: Keto versus Mediterranean. Which won?
description: In one corner: the medically renowned Mediterranean diet, a perennial favorite among nutritionists. The contender: the popular keto diet, known for restricting carbohydrates to a precious few per day.

title: Highland Park shooter's rooftop position made it difficult for officers to find him quickly as parade turned into chaos, police chief says
description: New details have emerged describing a scene filled with fear and chaos as a 21-year-old gunman opened fire during a Fourth of July parade in a Chicago suburb, where seven people were killed and dozens of others wounded.

title: Pro-Russia hackers claim disruption of US Congress website
description: Pro-Russia hackers claimed responsibility for a cyberattack that briefly interrupted access to a website for US Congress on Thursday night.

title: Prince Harry wins early victory in lawsuit against Mail on Sunday tabloid
description: A British high court judge has ruled that an article in The Mail on Sunday about the Duke of Sussex's legal claim against the UK Home Office was defamatory, the PA Media agency reports.

title: US will plunge into recession — but it didn't have to, former IMF chief economist says
description: It's "almost impossible" for the Fed to tamp down inflation without tipping the US economy into a recession, says Former IMF Chief Economist Ken Rogoff.

title: Hottest moments from the Paris couture shows
description: This week in Paris, a series of designer collections featuring handcrafted, one-of-a-kind, eye-wateringly expensive high fashion was once again unveiled during the city's biannual Haute Couture Week.

title: Novak Djokovic defeats Cameron Norrie to set up Wimbledon final against Nick Kyrgios
description: Novak Djokovic will face Nick Kyrgios in the Wimbledon final on Sunday as the top seed came from behind to defeat Cameron Norrie 2-6 6-3 6-2 6-4.

title: Former Trump WH attorney says Trump should be worried about Cipollone's testimony
description: Hear why former Trump White House attorney James Schultz says Pat Cipollone's testimony to the Jan. 6 committee should be worrisome to the former President.

title: Biden signs executive order aimed at safeguarding abortion rights
description: President Joe Biden signed an executive order Friday aimed at protecting abortion rights in response to the landmark decision by the Supreme Court overturning Roe v. Wade.

title: Former Angolan president Jose Eduardo dos Santos dies at 79
description: The former president of Angola, Jose Eduardo dos Santos, has died at the age of 79.

title: Japan's strict gun laws make shootings rare
description: The shooting of former Japanese Prime Minister Shinzo Abe has shocked Japan, a country with one of the world's lowest rates of gun crime due to its strict laws on gun ownership.

title: Sacha Baron Cohen wins defamation appeal brought by former Alabama judge
description: Actor Sacha Baron Cohen has defeated an appeal brought by former Alabama judge Roy Moore, who claimed the British comedian had defamed him in a program where he falsely accused Moore of being a pedophile.

title: Largest parrot colony in the world lives in Patagonia's crumbling cliffs
description: At the northern tip of Patagonia's desert coast in Argentina, the skies above El Cóndor are filled with shifting clouds of chatty, colorful parrots.

title: The Ukraine war has left one Middle East nation facing economic misery
Two generals share differing views on state of war in Ukraine
description: As Russia's push into the Donetsk region continues, more than 40 towns in Donbas have come under attack. CNN's Jim Sciutto discusses with General Wesley Clark and Lt. General Mark Hertling, who have differing views on the state of Putin's war in Ukraine.

title: Analysis: Camilla enlists Kate's help for magazine cover shoot
description: Perched on a bench in the garden, a pair of shears and a basket of flowers in hand, the Duchess of Cornwall appears at ease as the forthcoming cover star of a national magazine.

title: Israeli and Palestinian leaders speak by phone for the first time in years
description: Israel's new Prime Minister Yair Lapid and the Palestinian Authority President Mahmoud Abbas held a phone conversation Friday morning, which is believed to be the first such contact between Israeli and Palestinian leaders for five years.

title: Germany's biggest landlord turns down the heat as Russian gas shortage bites
description: Germany's biggest landlord will turn down the heat for hundreds of thousands of residents in the coming months as Russia throttles supplies of natural gas.

title: Boris Johnson has left a hellish task for his successor. But British Conservatives are delirious with relief
description: • Video: Boris Johnson's resignation one-liner breaks the internet

title: Gunman's father claims no responsibility over shooting
description: Robert Crimo Jr., the father of the confessed Highland Park parade shooter, says he thought his son was going to use the guns he helped purchase at the shooting range.

title: Sepp Blatter and Michel Platini acquitted of fraud in Swiss Court
description: Former FIFA and UEFA Presidents Sepp Blatter and Michel Platini have been acquitted of fraud, forgery and mismanagement in a court in Switzerland on Friday.

title: Paul Rudd FaceTimes 12-year-old boy after classmates refuse to sign his yearbook
description: Paul Rudd showed a young fan some much-deserved kindness.

title: Hear Zelensky's response to Putin falsely calling him a Nazi
description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky discusses Russian President Vladimir Putin's false claim that he is "denazifying" Ukraine, which Putin used as a justification for the invasion.

title: Doja Cat calls out Noah Schnapp for sharing her DMs about 'Stranger Things' crush
description: Doja Cat is not happy with Noah Schnapp.

title: Cyclist Daniel Oss withdraws from Tour de France after breaking neck in high-speed crash with fan
description: Cyclist Daniel Oss has been forced to retire from this year's Tour de France with a broken neck after he collided with spectators.

title: Megan Rapinoe pays tribute to Brittney Griner while receiving Presidential Medal of Freedom
description: As she received the Presidential Medal of Freedom -- the highest civilian honor in the United States -- Megan Rapinoe paid tribute to detained WNBA star Brittney Griner, wearing a cream blazer with the initials 'BG' and a bunch of flowers embroidered onto the lapel.

title: Why inflation isn't always bad for the stock market
description: If you follow markets news, you've probably seen a few hundred headlines this year akin to: "Stocks slide as red-hot inflation weighs on investors."

title: Is Covid-19 surging again? Our expert explains how to prepare
description: The much-awaited summer lull in coronavirus cases doesn't appear to be happening as Covid-19 infections continue to increase in much of the United States.

title: Tunisia's 'Minister of Happiness' Ons Jabeur aims to make more history at Wimbledon
description: Whenever Ons Jabeur steps onto a tennis court, she never plays solely for herself, but for the future generations she hopes to inspire.

title: Ups and downs of Japan's longest-serving prime minister
description: Japan's former Shinzo Abe has died after he was shot in Nara, Japan, during a campaign speech, according to NHK, quoting ruling Liberal Democratic Party sources. CNN's Will Ripley takes a look at the life of the longest-serving prime minister in Japanese history.

title: Baseball player Jurickson Profar collapses after huge collision with teammate
description: The San Diego Padres said Jurickson Profar was being evaluated in hospital after the 29-year-old collapsed after an outfield collision with his teammate on Thursday.

title: Africa's next big thing will be its tech startups, says prolific investor
description: Akintoye Akindele is a man on a mission to build a new Africa and he is not afraid to fail to get there.

title: Boris Johnson leaves a mess to clean up. But British Conservatives are delirious with relief
Hollywood won't budge for Chinese censors anymore. Here's what changed
description: Hollywood has long bent over backwards to give Chinese censors what they want. Not anymore.

title: USA qualifies for 2023 FIFA Women's World Cup
description: On July 7, 2019, the US Women's National Team (USWNT) won a record fourth World Cup title, confirming its dominance over the women's game.

title: See how other British prime ministers have resigned
description: From choreographed departures to emotional exists, here's how it ended for some of Britain's former leaders.

title: What it's like to land on the world's shortest commercial runway
description: Flying into Saba isn't for the faint hearted. The vertiginous slopes and sea cliffs of this five-square-mile island in the Caribbean don't leave much space to land a plane. But Juancho E. Yrausquin Airport, clinging to Saba's only bit of flat land, is proof that it can be done.

title: Record-setting golfer wants her win to be watershed moment
description: As Linn Grant left the course at Halmstad Golf Club in Tylösand, Sweden, she found herself swarmed by a group of young fans.

title: China is relentlessly trying to peel away Japan's resolve on disputed islands
description: For all the speculation of quick military action by China to achieve its foreign policy goals, Beijing's track record has been more akin to peeling an onion, slowly and deliberately pulling back layers to reach a goal at the center.

title: 'Leisure, pleasure': Why this fashion trend won't go out of style
description: The image of Britain's Prince Louis dressed in a miniature sailor suit was one of the standout moments of the recent Platinum Jubilee celebrations. Photographed screaming with his hands pressed over his ears as fighter jets roared above the Buckingham Palace balcony, all eyes were on the 4-year-old royal heir. While his animated reaction to the day's events made headlines, his outfit -- a go-to ensemble for British royals, including his father when he was a child -- was emblematic of the tradition that marked the event.

title: Video shows moment Shinzo Abe was shot
description: Former Japanese Prime Minister Shinzo Abe died after being shot while giving a campaign speech on a street in central Japan.

title: Boris Johnson's resignation one-liner breaks the internet
description: UK Prime Minister Boris Johnson resigned from his position with some unusual words to remember. CNN's Jeanne Moos tries to decode how his one-liner "them's the breaks" broke the internet.

title: Pilot's GoPro captures emergency landing on highway
description: After Vincent Fraser's engine began to fail, he was forced to land on a highway in North Carolina.
